definition: to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations

sentences.english: The bullet hit the centre of the target surely.
sentences.chinese: 那颗子弹不偏不倚地射中靶心。

sentences.english: But positive injection marksman at this time also scored impartial blade chest.
sentences.chinese: 但是正面射出的弩箭也在此时不偏不倚射入刀锋胸膛。

sentences.english: There are only two ways to be quite unprejudiced and impartial.
sentences.chinese: 只有两种办法可以做到不偏不倚。

sentences.english: To stay in the middle in what we do, without being biased or partial, is loyalty .
sentences.chinese: 凡事处中，不偏不倚，无党无私，这就是忠。

sentences.english: R26; The literary critics should be as objective as possible in analysis and judgment.
sentences.chinese: 文学批评家在分析和评价时应该尽量不偏不倚。

sentences.english: He wore prim suits with neckties set primly against the collar buttons of his white shirts.
sentences.chinese: 他西装笔挺，领带打结不偏不倚对准白衬衣领头纽扣。

sentences.english: An unprejudiced appraisal of the pros and cons.
sentences.chinese: 对支持者和反对者不偏不倚的评价。

sentences.english: The literary critics should be as objective as possible in analysis and judgment.
sentences.chinese: 文学批评家在分析和评价时应该尽量不偏不倚。

sentences.english: His even-handedness, though fair, occasionally becomes frustrating.
sentences.chinese: 他不偏不倚的态度，尽管公道，偶尔也会令人泄气。

sentences.english: The ball landed smack-dab at his feet.
sentences.chinese: 球不偏不倚正好落在他的脚上。

definition: middle/center/right in the middle or center/nub
to hit the nail on the head (idiom)
coming right into one's face/imminent/to put first
calm and unhurried (idiom); composed/to take matters calmly
(to escape danger etc) by a hair's breadth (idiom)/in a critical state/on the brink of crisis/very close (to happening)/Taiwan pr. [jian4 bu4 rong2 fa3]
to hit the target (esp. in argument)/to strike home
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4
